title: Pets in the City
question_text: The number of pets per household in a large city varies with mean $1.4$ and standard deviation $1.0$. Because a household cannot have a fraction of a pet, the population distribution cannot be Normal. The city animal control officer inspects $100$ apartments and calculates $\bar{x}$. What is the mean and standard deviation for the sampling distribution of average number of pets in samples of size $n=100$?
